identificationModule.briefTitle: Study to Compare Furmonertinib to Platinum-Based Chemotherapy for Patients with Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) with Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Exon 20 Insertion Mutations (FURVENT)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Global, Phase 3, Randomized, Multicenter, Open-Label Study to Investigate the Efficacy and Safety of Furmonertinib Compared to Platinum-Based Chemotherapy As First-Line Treatment for Patients with Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) with Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Exon 20 Insertion Mutations (FURVENT)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Global, Phase 3, randomized, multicenter, open-label study evaluating the efficacy and safety of furmonertinib (firmonertinib) at 2 dose levels (160 mg once daily \[QD\] and 240 mg QD) compared to platinum-based chemotherapy in previously untreated patients with locally advanced or metastatic non-squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) with Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) exon 20 insertion mutations. A target of approximately 375 patients will be randomized in a 1:1:1 ratio to treatment with furmonertinib 240 mg QD, furmonertinib 160 mg QD, or platinum-based chemotherapy.

armGroups.label: platinum-based chemotherapy
armGroups.description: carboplatin or cisplatin based on investigator's choice + pemetrexed intravenously

interventions.name: platinum-based chemotherapy
interventions.description: (carboplatin or cisplatin based on investigator's choice) + pemetrexed intravenously (IV)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Progression Free Survival (PFS) determined by blinded independent central review (BICR)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 32 months after first dose

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 62 months after first dose
Up to 36 months after first dose

Up to 36 months after first dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to second Progression Free Survival (PFS2)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 36 months after first dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PFS by blinded independent central review (BICR) in patients with a history or presence of brain metastases at baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 36 months after first dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to central nervous system (CNS) metastases by BICR
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization up to ≤30 days after last dose
Randomization up to ≤30 days after last dose
Randomization up to ≤30 days after last dose
Randomization up to ≤30 days after last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire Core 30 (QLQ-C30)
secondaryOutcomes.description: QLQ-C30 is a cancer-specific questionnaire comprised of 5 functional scales (physical, role, cognitive, emotional, and social functioning); 3 symptom scales (fatigue, pain, and nausea/vomiting); and a global health status/quality-of-life (QoL) scale. Six single-item scales are also included (dyspnea, insomnia, appetite loss, constipation, diarrhea, and financial difficulties).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization up to ≤30 days after last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in EORTC QLQ Lung Cancer Module Core 13 (QLQ LC13)
secondaryOutcomes.description: QLQ-LC13 is a cancer-specific questionnaire which comprises of 13 questions assessing lung cancer-associated symptoms (cough, hemoptysis, dyspnea, and site-specific pain), treatment-related side effects (sore mouth, dysphagia, peripheral neuropathy, and alopecia), and use of pain medication.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization up to ≤30 days after last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Symptom Assessment Questionnaire (NSCLC SAQ)
secondaryOutcomes.description: NSCLC-SAQ consists of 7 items assessing 5 NSCLC symptom concepts: cough, pain, dyspnea, fatigue, and poor appetite.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization up to ≤30 days after last dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of incidence and severity of adverse events (AEs) as a measure of safety and tolerability of Furmonertinib
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 36 months after first dose

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Plasma concentrations of furmonertinib and its major metabolite (AST5902)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Up to 36 months after first dose

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Key Inclusion Criteria:

* Histologically or cytologically documented, locally advanced or metastatic non-squamous Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) not amenable to curative surgery or radiotherapy.
* Documented results of the presence of an Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) exon 20 insertion mutation in tumor tissue or blood from local or central testing.
* No prior systemic anticancer therapy regimens received for locally advanced or metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) including prior treatment with any Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR)-targeting agents (e.g., previous (EGFR) TKIs, monoclonal antibodies, or bispecific antibodies).
* Patients who have received prior neo-adjuvant and/or adjuvant chemotherapy, immunotherapy, or chemo radiotherapy for non-metastatic disease (excluding EGFR-TKIs) must have experienced a treatment free interval of at least 12 months.
* Patients with a history of treated CNS metastases or new asymptomatic CNS metastases are eligible.

locations.state: Lingang Economic and Technological Development Zo
